Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory stay!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie V
Reviews.Content: Super friendly and informative staff! Clean, small rooms. Is a bit noisy with the train, but was like white noise to me. Very few places to eat immediately nearby that take credit/debit cards OR that you could feel comfortable ordering at since you're in the heart of chinatown.- menu appeared to only be in chinese, if there even was a menu-appeared to be markets that you can order food from.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon special”
Reviews.Author: adirb2
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Grreal location, good value- Go there!

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices in town”
Reviews.Author: majeins
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, not the most spacious. Adjusting the heat was a nightmare, the room was extremely hot!!!!! Good Breakfast nearby are not that easy to find. Over Priced!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Terrible Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: lafcomike
Reviews.Content: The Hotel 91 is located on the outskirts of Chinatown bordering the Lower East Side. When you enter the hotel, you have to walk a long desolate corridor and then take an elevator to the second floor reception area. The walk was a bit creepy and without security could be a little menacing. Anyway, when I took the elevator the the reception area, there was nobody there. So I waited and waited and waited. After 15 minutes, I called the hotel and heard the phone ringing, but nobody answered. So I waited....... after 24 min (I was checking) a guy came down the hall and mumbled something about being busy. When I informed him that I had been waiting almost a half hour to check in, he had no response and in fact refused to even make eye contact with me. He rattled off the perfunctory hotel information and put my key on the counter without telling me my room number or even acknowledging me at all. My room was tiny and had a musty smell. The bathroom floor was spotted with grime. The room was next to a subway track, but I am a deep sleeper so I wasnt really bothered by the passing trains. Many of the TV channels were unavailable (WCBS, WNBC). The next morning I got the heck out of this place ASAP. A really awful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Gave me an infection”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningCanuck
Reviews.Content: 1) Stayed in one of the inner rooms. Not ventilated, and obviously very mildewy and moldy. Got a very bad case of ringworm as a result (it's like a yeast infection of the skin -- itchy, painful and takes longer to go away). Thanks Hotel 91. 2) The property is my the Manhattan Bridge... you can't get away from the noise; don't even try. 3) Don't look under the bed; they never clean there. Be afraid, be very afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great for Tourists But Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeGem
Reviews.Content: It's a very loud hotel. If you want a good and calm night's sleep in a quiet area you will not get it here. If you are looking for a hotel near great restaurants you will not get it here. If you are looking for a hotel that is situated in a picturesque neighborhood with a lovely view... please just look somewhere else. What you get with this hotel is CHEAP and CLEAN. Cheap and clean can go a long way. I never felt unsafe but there is NO ONE on those streets at night. The train passes by the window REALLY close and my room had a view of only the train. I can sleep through anything (thankfully). The area is a really crowded Chinatown. Walking on those streets can be stressful but at least the train is nearbye. Ha ha.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 91”
Reviews.Author: laurenchellew
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to china town and little italy etc. Very very noisey though with train right out window and between room and room was very bad aswell. rooms were small but clean. Friendly staff and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 91 - Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: ckpt72
Reviews.Content: A good hotel, very clean, but a little noisy because the room was facing the railway line. Near a metro station with easy access to downtown New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Evierey
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay here. We stayed for 5 nights and found the staff very helpful. The noise wasn't a problem as the double glazing worked (room 706) We even got a good deal on a taxi to Newark Airport,way cheaper than the yello cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Chinatown! Clean and Modern.”
Reviews.Author: Samanthasosassy
Reviews.Content: We just checked out of this hotel today after a five day stay through new years. We stayed at a hotel around the corner in October and were less than pleased. We passed hotel 91 and marveled at how clean it looked and vowed to give them a try in two mo. I am so glad we did. Staff was accommodating. The room was super clean and smelled like cleaning products upon arrival. The beds are comfy with really comfy puffy sheets. We spent a lot of time in bed bc it was so comfy. Subway is a short block or two. The noice from the bridge is annoying but earplugs work. Price was great! No breakfast :-( we were bummed about this but all in all... Great hotel -we will be back! Thanks hotel 91! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Right in China town.”
Reviews.Author: lidk
Reviews.Content: Service - The staff was very nice. I did not know my way around, and asked many questions, all of which, were answered. I asked the staff how to get somewhere so she took out a map gave it to me, and routed which subway I should take, and wrote it down step by step, and even showed me how to get home. Value - Value was okay. I never went to New York before so I'm not sure how much it usually runs for but I paid $199 for a night with one queen sized bed. Sleep Quality - Beds were nice and cushioned. Pillows were fluffy and sheets were clean. Location - ITS GREAT! For me at least. The only problem I see that could potentially turn people away is that its right next to the tracks so you can hear every time a subway/train go by. In my opinion, it wasnt that loud, and wasnt annoying. BUT it is right in the middle of chinatown so its a plus. Overall, I think this hotel is a good choice. It was very clean throughout. Room was clean, bathroom was clean, hallways was also clean. They offer free tea, and coffee in the lobby, BUT BEWARE! The big water bottle in the room itself is $3.00!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel clean but Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: filifilo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in August for 5 days in Hotel 91 and I appreciate the cleaness of our room. The ratio between price and quality was good. Obviously for that price this hotel is suggested. The position is really close to Underground station to visit Manhattan. We stay in the hotel only to sleep so it was perfect. But the smell of Chinatown area is really terrible. Despite other customers comments we didn't hear train noise during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Insane noise - feels like a highway through the room”
Reviews.Author: Tine_Babiarz
Reviews.Content: ...and I'm NOT sensitive towards noise. The hotel is located right next to / under the Manhattan bridge and in the daytime every 4 minute a train runs by and the building is almost shaking. Add to this the terrible and constant smell of fish in Chinatown and you definitely do not have a boutique hotel experience! I haven't lived other places in New York, but compared to the experiences of friends and family, I would say that you are better of choosing a more centrally located hotel - the few extra dollars will be well spend. The upside of Hotel 91 is that it's clean, has comfortable beds and a nice clean, spacious bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Ray was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Brooke S
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the tourist section of NYC this hotel is not for you. If you are looking for the Ritz, this is definately not it. What you have is a gem located in Chinatown. I stayed here in September for 1 week with my sister and bestfriend and had the best time. My personal advice is that if you flew in to NYC (via LaGuardia) you can get a week train pass from the Hudson News Stand for like $29 dollars. It is located by baggage claim. GET THIS! YOU WILL GET YOUR MONEYS WORTH....even if your stay 3 or 4 days, at $2.25 each way it adds up fast. Anyway, the F train is a 5 min walk. My sister and I did not pack any bathroom toiletries and we found everything we needed across the street at the asian pharmacy. It had everything we needed. There is a Starbucks about a 15 min walk at Allen and Delancey. If your worried about the walk then you better get used to it, that seems to be all that you do in NYC. After going out at night in the East Village I took a cab back and with generous tip I spent $10. Back to the hotel, it is very clean, had an Iron and board, and a blow dryer, clean towels, ice and vending machines. If you come to NYC to stay in the room and order room sevice you better stay in Midtown and pay the price. If you are coming to NYC and want to dig in and enjoy what the city has to offer than this is the best place to stay. I dont think most people are realistic in their expectations when staying places, certaintantly in New York. Stay here and see for yourself, and if you think its bad....book a room at The Carter in Midtown for a night and then let us know what you think. I guarantee you will be looking at the "glass half full" after that. Thank you Hotel 91 for a great stay....See you in December for 5 days

Reviews.Title: “good honest little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas C
Reviews.Content: When I come to New York my hotel room is nothing but an sleeping pad. Keeping that in mind this hotel is clean, beds are comfortable and the rooms are mold free. Noise could be a factor for you as it is located right next to the Manhattan bridge, but with double glass windows it was not an issue for me. The staff is minimum, no concierge, no bellboy, but professional and helpful. There is NO Wi Fi, but the rooms are equipped with a LAN cable and the speed of the connection is good. If you need a computer, they have one (with printer) alongside the vending machines on the 4th floor. TV is limited. But if you come to NY to watch TV maybe you should stay home. It is in Chinatown, that means the streets are dirty and smelly and all that. But it also means that you are 2 blocks away from the F train and therefore 15 min from anywhere in Manhattan you may want to go. One thing: coming back late at night could be a bit daunting by the looks of it. The streets around it are deserted and you may feel uneasy. But the same is true for every other lower manhattan hotel ten times more expensive. Which brings me to the price: I know it is expensive, but not for Manhattan. Your options on this price bracket are usually awful (The Carter, The Pennsylvaniaâ€¦) and this hotel is way better than those in what really matters to me: A good bed, a good room, a clean hotel. This is an honest good little hotel and I havenâ€™t found a better value in Manhattan yet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but location is a problem”
Reviews.Author: Fizzbin2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of weeks ago - choosing it as it was a good value alternative to my usual NY hotel (The Pod Hotel). The room I had was fine and the noise from the Manhattan Bridge/trains very close by did not cause me any problems - I slept fine most nights. I did get accused of smoking in my room by one of the maids (I am a non smoker) which was a bit irritating - presumably just because I had left a window open for ventilation. The real problem with the hotel was the location - it is of course in Chinatown and therefore there were few of the standard NY locations anywhere nearby. No branches of regular chains like Starbucks, Duane Reade, Walgreens and no diners anywhere which meant I had to travel up town to find one each morning. So it is a good value hotel but you will feel like you are in Beijing rather than New York.

Reviews.Title: “Very loud and rundown hotel”
Reviews.Author: ale w
Reviews.Content: This is not a boutique hotel. Cheap, loud and cheesy is what this hotel is. Very very loud you will feel like a highway running through your room. It's time they remodel it and at the minimum paint the hallways and the room. They only provide soap and shampoo in the room so plan on taking everything else. The rooms are very small. The hotel main entrance is on the second floor a little odd. I would not stay there again. The location is not good. Very very loud. We could not sleep at all it was impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, very clean, very reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian H
Reviews.Content: I'd read a few reviews of this hotel before travelling, so I confess to a certain level of trepidation regarding a number of issues, particularly the proximity to the apparently very noisy Manhattan Bridge flyover and the out-of-way location. I was pleasantly surprised on both those fronts. Firstly, I had a room at the rear of the hotel, right next to the bridge on the second floor (the lowest occupied level) and the noise was almost non-existent - equivalent to the occasional, gentle rumbling of distant thunder. I don't know if this is worse on higher floors, but having heard so much about the trains going past, I was hugely relieved, and I slept like a baby every night on the immensely comfortable bed. IIt was certainly a LOT quieter than having to listen to the constant beeping of cab horns all night long when I stayed in a hotel in midtown. Secondly, Chinatown was a brilliant location in which to stay. The hotel is a mere two blocks away from the subway station (F train - a few stops into the city) and a short walk away from the financial district, the East village, downtown etc. Also, Chinatown itself is a really fascinating, vibrant, colourful area of Manhattan - full of interesting sights, sounds and yes, smells. It is also home to dozens and dozens of excellent restaurants. Can recommend the Famous Sichuan, and Red Egg. If you really need some US style breakfast, walk for a few minutes, or get the subway uptown. Walked home a few nights at between 1am and 3am and it was very safe. The room was a decent size for Manhattan and extremely clean. Service was excellent, and the sheets and towels changed every night. Really impressed with the housekeeping. Staff at reception were very friendly and helpful, and there's free tea and coffee in a lobby area just down from reception. It's not the Ritz, sure, but it was really comfortable and great value for money. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Take your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: Carol P
Reviews.Content: Good things: The location wasn't too bad - easy access to walk Downtown and 5 mins walk to East Broadway subway with good links Mid and Uptown. Great for eating out in Chinatown and Little Italy. The area seemed safe at all hours, but the hotel was a bit out of the way if you want to return before going out again in the evening. The air con was quiet and efficient. Bad things: Our main gripe was the noise from the traffic on Manhattan Bridge - the proximity of the trains/vehicles to the bedrooms meant that every train passing was audible in the room, and they pass 24 hours a day! Although towels were changed, the bathroom cleaned and the beds made every day, the room was not hoovered or dusted, nor was the bedding changed over a 9 night stay. There were only 4 coathangers for 2 people in a wardrobe that appeared close to collapse, and no other storage facilities. My friend lived out of his suitcase for the whole stay. The iron was unusable as the plate was filthy (not that there was any space to iron). No safe in the room, or provision for safekeeping valuables at reception. Only one extremely slow elevator serving all staff/customers. Reception forgot to order our taxi to the airport (and still charged $3.00 to make the delayed call - thanks for that). On check-in, we were advised of the 24 hour tea/coffee making facilities on floor 2 - powdered milk and coffee? no thanks. Deli 2 doors away did decent coffee and pastries for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SueS927
Reviews.Content: Hidden away on the Lower East Side in China Town,walking distance to Canal Street.. the Bowery and all those great old red tenement buildings with fire escapes on the front synonymous with the Dirty Gritty New York City. The subway is very close by to get yourself up to Times Sq and Central Park and all the usual attractions this amazing town has to offer. The hotel is next to Manhattan Bridge so you can watch the traffic wizz by the window including the trains.. but its very quiet considering its so close... the double glazing really works.. Everything is very clean including the long hall way to the elevator that takes you to reception. Bathrooms are clean and easy to move around and the beds very comfortable. For the price its exceedingly good value. I've stayed before and I'll certainly be going back again.... Ohh you can also leave your luggage for the day at $2 a bag...

Reviews.Title: “More pros than cons”
Reviews.Author: angeljezabell
Reviews.Content: Yes it's in Chinatown but it's a five minute walk from the subway and we found a great little diner (the cup and saucer) a bar and lots of non Chinese places to eat all within a couple of blocks. It's five minutes to canal street and ten (max) to little Italy. It's my fourth visit to NY and I will be staying here again which is more than I can say for the other hotels I've stayed in. It's very clean, the bathroom is basic so bring your own toiletries, there is a bath as well as a shower but the towels are small (they do the job though) the bed is super comfy (and clean) and although space is limited we managed perfectly well for the six days we were there. Yes the train is noisy but no more noisy than traffic can be. There's no safe in the room but everything was ok that we left there. If you want to wander round and experience 'real' New York then this is a great little hotel in a great location. If your after doing the sights and being a total tourist then perhaps the location may be a bit too far from times square for you. I know I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cheap, & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Renny83
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from a girls weekend in NYC. We were first drawn to Hotel 91 due to price and location. We were sold when we arrived to a clean, quiet twin room (which was larger than we expected). We didn't spend much time in our room (because, HELLO, you're in NYC), but it was absolutely perfect for what we needed. Points worth considering: 1. You are next to the Manhattan Bridge (in fact our room was almost ontop of it). I have stayed in other NYC hotels and the street noise was unbearable. This was not our experience with Hotel 91. The train noise wasn't an issue. 2. You are in Chinatown. My friend and I routinely roamed the streets and subway and felt safe during our 2 1/2 day stay. Our stay at Hotel 91 allowed as to spend our money and time doing what we wanted - - eat, drink, and take NYC by storm.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if appeal is not a requirement”
Reviews.Author: Molly W
Reviews.Content: The Hotel 91 is very clean, quiet enough and quite acceptable if you like the price range and are OK with the dirty and extremely urban nature of this part of Chinatown (read: major urban smells and dirt). Nothing fancy or dressy, no sitting area or chairs, etc, but quite clean, acceptable beds and bath, for those interested in a bug-free, tidy, no frills option.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean & Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Amanda J
Reviews.Content: I was a little put off my being in the heart of Chinatown at first, but once I checked in and got to my room I was pleasantly surprised. Yes, the room is small, but cozy, clean, the bed is extremely comfortable. The wireless Internet in your room is complimentary (huge bonus) and it's right by a train. While the amenities are limited (there's no coffee maker and no restaurant close enough to get the coffee--LOL) I was all together happy with my stay, the staff, the front desk agent, and the manager. Great affordable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in center of everything you want to see in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: MCOOL2010
Reviews.Content: We spent a few months looking for an affordable hotel on Manhattan, since most of the things we wanted to do were there. The hotel room was for 4 people, two double beds. The beds were very very comfortable, although the room was very small. We had to take turns walking between the beds. It was right next to the manhattan bridge, but it didn't disturb our sleep in the least, slept perfectly. Down the street from the F train, and alot of other train stops are walkable. Felt very safe walking around the neighborhood as there is always people out, its a very busy area. Its also next to a fish market, so it will smell when you first get out in front of it, but it passes once you walk past the stalls. The main point is that it was very very CLEAN, no bed bugs! Hard to find that in Manhattan! They also hold your luggage for 2 dollar each the day you leave, which is more affordable then other places across Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “CosÃ¬ e cosÃ¬”
Reviews.Author: robi1963
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, the room was not so big but clean, from the window you can see and hear the train running , so it is rather noisy. Good price. It is in the very hearth of Chinatown, not do far from brooklin bridge. Public transportation are near the hotel too, The reception is not located at the entrance but you have to go to the second floor, people of the staff are friendly and helpful, the internet connection is free if you have a laptop, otherwise you have to pay. Good hotel but bad location.

Reviews.Title: “If you are not Chinese, this location is exceptionally poor”
Reviews.Author: sedmai
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here, my friend made the reservations. It is a very clean hotel, with comfortable beds and adequate in-room amenities. $166 per night for room with two double beds during my stay. No coffee maker, no fridge, but instant coffee in the lobby. Believe the other reviewers who state that the train noise is problematic -- it is astonishingly loud, even with the good quality, modern, double-paned windows. Pay $20 extra per night for the double-double-bed rooms -- there are only two per floor, they face the street not the train. While this location is technically Soho (south of Houston St, with central Soho being trendy and filled with cafes and such), THIS HOTEL IS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE DOWNSCALE PART OF CHINATOWN, it is not even the touristy part of Chinatown. There is not a typical convenience store or diner within several blocks in any direction. There is no food other than chinese food for a LOONNNGGG distance in any direction, although a KFC is several blocks away (towards what tourists think of as Chinatown). The nearest subway station is two LONG blocks away, in the direction away from the nicer part of Chinatown. After dark, the entire neighborhood shuts down because this is a business area, so there is NOTHING to do besides eat at a chinese restaurant. The walk back to the hotel after dark -- particularly at 11pm if you travelled up to Broadway to see a show -- is desolate and creepy. DO NOT try it alone, even though police officers are stationed near the East Broadway station and will offer escort to travelers walking alone, which is a very strong warning that you should heed. In order to reach any tourist area other than Chinatown, you will have a long ride on the F train, and only the local F stops at the East Broadway station. If everything goes well, and you happen to catch the F quickly, and then catch your connecting train very quickly, you are still going to be AT LEAST 30 - 45 minutes to reach Times Square, Columbus Circle, etc. The time you spend waiting and traveling will leach daylight hours and personal energy out of your vacation, so do not be tempted by a "cheap" hotel rate in this incredibly poor location. If you spend an extra $50 a night to stay in a modest hotel closer to midtown you will make it back on subway fare and cabs that you won't need to take. Having said that.... if you stay here you will want to bring a cooler for snacks and beverages. There are no bars, cafes, coffee shops for after-dinner drinks or dessert nearby, you will need to provide for yourself in your room. Bring a day pack because once you leave your room you will likely not return until dark - it is just too far. While in more typical areas of the city, remember to stop in a drug or convenience store to buy anything needed -- there are no stores of that type near Hotel 91 and you will be trapped in your hotel after dark unless you arrange for a cab. Good things nearby: Wonderful dim sum and authentic chinese food 3 - 4 blocks away in the nice/tourist part of Chinatown. Little Italy several blocks away (but not walkable at night, there's another cab ride), lots of inexpensive but good personal services like beauty salons, foot massage/reflexology shops, chinese bakeries with interesting pastries to try. Sadly, that's about it. SHOP HARDER AND FIND A SIMILARLY-PRICE HOTEL CLOSER TO MIDTOWN!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Viktsjob01
Reviews.Content: One of the good things about this hotel is that itâ€™s situated in a very good place. Chinatown is beautiful and very interesting. The hotel was also rather close to the subway and the connections were good. The staff was nice and had a great taxi service that took you to the airportâ€¦ driving to Newark was about 60 dollars. They also had tea for free, vending machines, and a TV area. The rooms were nice and ok size. However, they were not the cleanest Iâ€™ve seen. But thatâ€™s not really the reason to why I wouldnâ€™t stay here again. The reason is the itch I got from the bed. Iâ€™m sure it wasnâ€™t bedbugs or anything, but Iâ€™m also sure it was from the bed. I got the rash after sitting in the bed for only ten minutes and they just got worse and worse. They were mostly on my legs, but also on the arms. I think it was because of the mattress or maybe even the detergent. I should add that Iâ€™m not allergic to anything and usually not even sensitive to things like that. It made the stay rather unpleasant. Another very annoying thing was the fact that the bed sheets were to small for the bed. They ended about half a meter before the bed did. It was kind of disgusting since the mattress was dirty and covered with a lot of hair from all parts of the body. I had to take one of the towels and put it down there just to cover it. Not very nice! So next time I go to New York I will look for another hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, small hotel in Chinatown.”
Reviews.Author: Cardiogelf1
Reviews.Content: Location = crap, unless you like or need to be living in Chinatown. But for value and cleanliness, it's hard to beat. One kind of expects a fleabag here, but what one gets is a spotless, new modern hotel, with ample space, all of the basic amenities (minus parking, which is hard to expect in New York City anyway), TV, clean bathrooms and attentive service. Would recommend overall, unless you have kids - in which case the rooms are probably too small. Also, don't come here if you're not used to the sounds of the big city - the Manhattan Bridge is going to be 20 yards from your window, with trains running every 3 minutes. Lullaby music to MY ears.

Reviews.Title: “Has its Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: jeremycriss
Reviews.Content: Accomodations weren't bad for the price in NYC. However, its located in Chinatown and not always easy to find an available taxi. The rooms are super small (which was expected for the location & price) and if you are a light sleeper that is bothered by noise, you might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “largest hotel room I have ever had in NYC”
Reviews.Author: houstonkar
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large, beds comfortable, front desk helpful, F train 2 blocks away. Easy walk to Little Italy and vendors on Canal St. Noise from the train on the Manhattan bridge was NOT a problem on the 4th floor with a room in the front of the hotel. Felt safe walking the neighborhood at night. Would stay at this hotel again -- great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good If You Have a Hearing Problem”
Reviews.Author: Jonas065
Reviews.Content: If you have a hearing problem, Hotel 91, in Chinatown, New York, is a fine choice. The room I stayed in was quite large, clean, and the bed was comfortable. However, the noise made by the passing trains, every five minutes or so, was so overpowering it made my stay almost unbearable. I asked the reception for another, more quiet room. I was told I was actually staying in "one of the quiet parts of the hotel." Makes me wonder about the other rooms. The hotel has no room service, in fact no food service at all. There is a vending machine on the fourth floor, mostly containing junk. The nearby restaurants were generally dreadful. There is, however, a Starbucks in the vicinity, but it takes about ten minutes to walk to it.. The people at the reception were ok, if somewhat impersonal and distant. I can't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has gone downhill. Don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: pamelaSimon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 91 last year and was pleased. However, I just returned from there and found that the cleanliness left much to be desired. I was traveling with my students and stayed there because we were exploring the Lower East Side. One of my students noticed a mouse in his room. After checking under the bed, we noticed mouse traps and found them under our bed as well. We reported this to the main desk and they switched the student's room but they are obviously aware they have mice and do not have the problem under control. Do not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: TheMoorNextDoor
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with the hotel considering the low price I paid for the room. Hotel 91 was very clean and service is great. I had leftover food I wanted to heat up and the front desk let me use the microwave in their kitchen. Free Coffee/tea located in the lobby (second floor of the building along with the front desk). I thought the room size was perfect for two people. I was a bit worried about the noise from the subway /traffic as remarked by other reviewers, but I didn't experience that problem despite having a room facing the bridge. Location is also great depending on what you're looking for. The hotel is located in the middle of Chinatown (3 Blocks from the F train), surrounded by Chinese/Asian stores and restaurants, so there's not much variety in nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blonde83
Reviews.Content: Traveled to New York for St. Patrick's Day. Wanted a hotel that was clean and affordable. This hotel is in the heart of China Town. Had a great view of the Empire State Building from our hotel. Very cute boutique hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Mbira
Reviews.Content: Hotel 91's location makes it very easy to get around the city, plus, because its in Chinatown, you almost feel like you've taken a trip to China. The noise of the trains didn't bother me because it's not an abrupt noise that would wake me up. I did have problems with hearing every move our upstairs neighbors made though. The room was relatively clean and spacious, particularly by NYC standards. The heater didn't work quite as well as I would have liked, but there was no frostbite. Overall, I would stay here again, but I would ask for a room on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but nice”
Reviews.Author: mickeymansfield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my friend who has mobility problems. Staff could not have been more helopful, ordering taxis, even carrying our luggage to the airport taxi for us and refsuing a tip. Our room was feet from the railway and the bridge, so in spite of double-glazing, noise was an issue. There are rooms on the street-side which would be quieter. Fu=ive minute walk to E. Broadway subway - not a problem for me, but my friends struggled - no lifts at the station and 77 steps each way up and down. No local places serving "English" breakfast, so we had to go into the Midtown really. Very clean if basically furnished room. Free coffee 24/7. Great staff, very secure location, very interesting to walk into Midtown thru the Canal St district. Enjoyed it but would not stay there again - prefer a midtown location..

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money...”
Reviews.Author: xXloulabelleXx
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay in the Hotel 91, Chinatown with a friend. Overall, I would sum up the experience as good value for money, we booked a few months ago and it was one of the cheapest deals for a 3 star hotel in Manhattan (with flight). The (single queen) room wasn't huge, but there was reasonable space for two. The bed was fairly comfortable and the room and hotel generally were exceptionally clean! The only down side is the subway which backed on to our room but I imagine if you could request a room on the other side there would be no such problem with noise, having said that we were so exhausted after sightseeing and shopping all day that we slept reasonably well anyway. Location: being located in Chinatown there obviously is not much but Chinese restaurants directly outside in terms of food however, there is a diner called 'Everest' Diner about 3-4 blocks away if you turn left out of the hotel which does nice pancakes for breakfast and is fairly reasonable. Wall street, the seaport (for Staten Island Ferry), The World Trade Centre and Century 21 (massive department store with loads of bargains) are about a 15-20 walk away and the subway for stops like Rockerfeller and central Manhattan stops (F train) is about 2-3 blocks away if you turn right outside the hotel (Grand St.) Overall, a very comfortable and enjoyable stay no it may not be the Ritz but you get what you pay for. Would return in future although I love to try different hotels so will probably stay somewhere more central next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for short trip”
Reviews.Author: vanhiephoang
Reviews.Content: Likes: - location direct in chinatown - restaurants nearby - close to travelbus - NY business district nearby - close to underground Dislikes: - the rooms are facing the Manhattan bridge, hence noisy.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: tom123187069
Reviews.Content: it was ok, not the best, chain town smells very bad, but the subway was very close which was very good, hotel staff helpful, room clean, but abit noise as the subway runs right next door

Reviews.Title: “A little spooky with good beds”
Reviews.Author: TravelBunny91
Reviews.Content: In the depth of Chinatown and its smells. Rooms are spacious but expect stained carpet and barren walls. Four women travelling together with no secondary mirror in room. Adequate bathroom with comfy beds. Bed linen appeared clean. Noticed no sprinkler system in room. OK if you spend absolutely no time in the room other than sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Good-value clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: roxanne121
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in a recent trip to NY. The hotel is in the middle of Chinatown: it was clean, the bed was comfortable (and no bedbugs!) and well maintained. Our room was, I think, the smallest, and was described as a 'single full' which meant we had a double bed, TV, decent bathroom - we didn't go to NY to spend much time in our room and it was more than adequate for our needs. Internet access is available in the lobby for $3 per 1/2 hour. We were on the second floor and yes the train going past was noisy but I found that comforting and it didn't affect our sleep in any way. It's a good place from which to explore NY as a number of subway lines serve Canal Street which is always lively and vibrant. Top tip: try the Grand Sichuan on 125 Canal Street for some of the best Sichuan food we have ever tasted.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: cks10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of 7 family members - 5 of whom had not been to New York before - and it was the perfect place to stay. It isn't 'central' but the taxi cabs are so reasonably priced, especially between a large group, that it wasn't a problem and we could easily get around. It was an easy walk to the Financial District and Little Italy too. The reception staff were very accommadating and gave advice and sorted out taxi cabs for us. Our rooms were a decent size, clean and the beds were very comfortable! We had a quiet room so had no noise from the train but my parents had a room outside the train lines but even they had a good nights sleep. Would definitely recommend this hotel - it is a little further out if you plan on sightseeing etc, but the price, staff and cleanliness makes it so worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in NYC!!”
Reviews.Author: PhilUSA2010
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here!! Bed was so comfortable, spotless room, marble bathroom and very reasonable price. Staff were very helpful. I liked overlooking the bridge, seeing trains and people going past and even had a view of Lower Manhattan buildings. Yes the area (Chinatown) does have a bit of a smell out on the street, but you can walk to the Brooklyn Bridge, Heliport, Battery Park and trains to take you to midtown Manhattan in 10 minutes. Thank you Hotel 91 for a great stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: 2909jen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Oct & for the price we payed we got pretty much as we expected, a clean basic room that was more than comfortable for our stay. We got a room facing the railway & it in no way affected our sleep (we even took earplugs after reading reviews & they weren't needed). My only downside was the location, we had to get the subway to get to most places of interest & that proved to be quite confusing on several occasion, however once you get used to it, it does get easier. If you are looking for a basic reasonably priced hotel for a break in NYC this is for you, if your are looking for luxury hotel with all the frills look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location could be better.”
Reviews.Author: treehouse79
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean hotel with friendly helpful staff at a good price. If China town is the area you want to stay in then this is the ideal budget hotel. Less than 5 mins walk to nearest subway and less than 15 mins walk to little Italy. BUT...if this is your first time in New York, I would suggest staying somewhere closer to Times Square to reduce your time spent on the subway.

Reviews.Title: “A Top-shelf Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeCervone
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews prior to checking-in. Yes, this hotel is in the middle of bustling Chinatown, with all that implies: open-air markets, moving crowds, amazing food, et al. It is a bustling area close to the Bowery, Little Italy, SOHO, Battery Park and more. In other words; it's alive and fun. The staff was wonderful, the rooms immaculate and the beds were incredibly comfortable and "bedbug"-free. Don't worry about the "L"; you really can't hear it...and we were in the last room on the hall, closest to t he tracks. A great value on the Lower East side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Rooms but terrible area!”
Reviews.Author: michelle100881
Reviews.Content: Me and my my 5 friends stayed here in September, the Hotel itself inside is nice and clean and the rooms are great and good value, but this hotel is situated in the worsed area in china town, theres no decent places to eat for miles and its right next to train tracks so the trains are very loud, believe it or not though you actually become immune to the noise and after a night or so it didnt bother me! the staff are lovely here i really cant fault the hotel apart from the awful location! If you dont mind walking a good half hour to eat somewhere thats not chinese then this place will be fine! there is a subway (orange line) 2 mins from the hotel but its almost impossible to get a cab here, plus everytime we were in central manhattan and stopped a cab hardly any cab drivers knew where this was. I wouldnt go back to this hotel! id spend a little extra for something in a better area! plus china town stinks due to all the cooking :(

Reviews.Title: “Read before you book!”
Reviews.Author: CheemaSingh
Reviews.Content: As with all hotels its best to do some research before you book. This hotel is based in the middle of Chinatown. This is a bonus if you are Chinese but can prove difficult if you are not, I had trouble finding a foreign currency exchange in the immediate area and most people in the local shops stuggle with understand and speaking english. The hotel is fairly clean no complaints there. But the rooms were small and narrow. We had two rooms booked and neither had a safe to lock our passports/monmey away in. The hotel does offer a safe service but it is one big safe which is kept elsewhere in the building and everybody to opts into using it has access to it. The room also had minimal storage space for clothes. The biggest problem was the location of the Manhatton Bridge, from our bedroom window it must have been no more than 10meters away, this bridge services trains and a highway so the noise is constant. The break out areas and reception are fairly dull and boring too. For the price i would imagine there are several better hotels for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Can you sleep on a railway????”
Reviews.Author: Kitsilano66
Reviews.Content: Terrible stay at Hotel 91 in NYC. Booked on Expedia and paid about $280 a night for trying to get a sleep at about 100ft from a train railway!! Cleanliness of the hotel: less than average, bathroom floor dirty, some hair around,...If you want some advice....stay away from this real nightmare...

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 10carter10
Reviews.Content: It's never a good sign when the staff are desperate for you to settle your bill as you check in. The hotel is the only place for 5 blocks or so that isn't a chinese restaurant or other chinese food store; this might not sound too bad but try getting a coffee or some breakfast from one of these places! It also meant the sidewalks were littered with lots of rubbish, and consequently rats (one just missed my foot one night). Whilst I didn't feel unsafe, the area was deserted at night and the subway is a couple of blocks away. The room was awful, no main light in the bedroom, just 2 lamps (one of which stopped working during the stay) and the bathroom has a giant flourescent light which is enough to give you a headache. The toilet blocked during our stay though this was fixed swiftly. The internet didn't work properly. The single lift didn't work properly. The room hadn't been cleaned properly (i found a cigarette lighter on the floor by the side of my bed. The staff were surly and disinterested. They authorised $500 more on my friends card than they told us they were going to. They were most distressed that my friend and I wanted to split the bill right down the middle. We have since left to find they have overcharged her by around $100, and after we contacted them they acknowleged their mistake saying it was because they undercharged me by this amount (i'm not sure how this is possible as I have the receipt here!). Not worth the money, and there are far better hotels in New York.

Reviews.Title: “perfect match for budgettravelers”
Reviews.Author: dsmeel
Reviews.Content: Hotel 91 is located central in chinatown, busy street, fishshop next to the hotel, noisy metrorail just next. But what a place! Staff most friendly. Perfect silent airco, good spacy rooms, clean, good bathroom, ok shower. free ice, coffee, tea. Taxiservice to the airfileds. Internetcomputer $5 per hour. Safe environment in day and night (with two blonde teenagegirls we felt completely safe). On the fronsite rooms may be very noisy because of the metroline, on the backsite it's nice silent, so ask for a room in the back. 2 blocks from metrostation. And for all: your downtown Manhatten in walkingdistance of chinatown, lower eastside, little italy, wallstreet etc.Cheap and good chinese restaurants all around you. No extra luxary, but for the budgettraveler it could not be better!

Reviews.Title: “Descent and affordable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Ibert
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at Hotel 91 and the overall experience was very good. We had specifically asked for a room not facing the Manhattan Bridge and we got a room without windows which was good since there was no noice at all. The location in Chinatown is excellent with walking distance (if you like to walk) to lower east side, SoHo, Brooklyn bridge, Wall street etc. However, don't forget to explore Chinatown while staying there! To sum up, this hotel is not for anyone wanting to stay in a fancy designer hotel with West village setting, but for anyone who is looking for an affordable stay to sleep with good location on Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Did you have to pay upfront or at checkout-please advise”
Reviews.Author: Diatra48
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were disappointed to learn that the credit card/debit we booked the hotel with over online 2-3 months before the trip was not acceptable when we arrived. We were told that we had to have a card that would authorize our entire stay and that it would charge it but it would hold that amount. That though a wrench in our entire 6 day stay as some were waiting on paychecks to hit so the cash they had was accounted for as there were no plans to pay upfront. We have seen hotels advise online must pay in advance. However, this hotel did not advise that at all. Please include your experience with pay good or bad for all to know.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: 7wX
Reviews.Content: We spent 15 days total in that hotel. First week the main elevator was out of order but someone was 24/7 running the service elevator. Hotel is really near from Manhattan Bridge so noise could be a problem for some. Great location near many stores and subway stations. Would return there if we were going back to NYC. Just a quick warning : The hotel charges $2 per luggage if you need to store them on departure. ($1 was announced)

Reviews.Title: “Our room was small. There was 4 of us...”
Reviews.Author: tyjune
Reviews.Content: Our room was small. There was 4 of us that stayed here in rooms and my room was the worst. We had the most people in our room ( 4) and our room was the smallest. It was smelly, not enough room to spread our luggage, but it was fairly clean. The accomodations were just Ok...spent very little time there. But the worst thing was the smell outside the hotel...it was sickening. My daughter could not stand to breathe. It was horrible. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Crazy4Canines
Reviews.Content: Travelled to NYC with a friend back in May 08 - the hotel was booked by my company and according to their website - "Hotel 91 is the perfect synergy between luxurious downtown boutique" - well I am not sure where they have stayed before if they think this is luxurious! Arrived outside the hotel which is in the middle of Chinatown - very shabby, garbage was everywhere outside! Inside was like something out of a horror movie until you found your way to reception! No restaurant or ANYWHERE to get food or drink. No cafes or shops near the hotel either so we always had to venture out in a taxi and bring things back. The hotel room backed on to the subway and every ten minutes (I kid you not) a tube would come past and the whole room shook! It was like something out of a sitcom! We had no sleep the whole 3 nights we were there. Never stay at this hotel - pay more money and get what you deserve - for what this hotel is it was a rip off anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, okay location”
Reviews.Author: Mimix1982
Reviews.Content: We visited Hotel 91 for 6 day in late June. It was easy to find, and the girl at the reception was very nice and helpsom. The room was big, with 2 queensize beds, flat screen tv and a nice bath. The windows are doubleglased, no noise and we slept like babies. The elevator was EXTREMELY slow, use the stairs when you can. We had a nice stay, everyone who worked at the hotel was very nice. The area is Chinatown with a lot of bad smell...... Just 2 blocks from the subway line F. We ate breakfast at a place called "Desserts NYC" over the street from the subway entrence. Nice place, really sweet girls working there, a small place , but highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean but noisy trains”
Reviews.Author: MrBenjamin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a sight seeing trip. Somewhere to lay your head at night, and crash out when worn out from walking around New York. Very basic, but clean and tidy, with good reception staff, unfortunately no-one mentioned the highway and the train lines some 30 yards from our room. We were unlucky and got the 'train side' of the hotel which meant the overland trains passing all night and every 60 seconds from 6am - 9am (very noisy, and shook the room), so no sleep on night no 2. Such a disappointment and this was a good value hotel, unfortunately positioned. On the plus side it did have free internet access which was the fastest connection i have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “This is thebest place ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernNashville
Reviews.Content: We had 2 double bed rooms on the 7th floor. The hotel is an oasis in the dessert! The staff is the most friendly, helpful and knowledgable of any hotel I have ever been. It does have a train but it's all about the city. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms but noisy”
Reviews.Author: NL_awt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in may, and stayed in two different rooms. The first one was the biggest and less noisiest (you are nearly IN the Manhattan bridge), the other one was smaller (still OK and clean), but very noisy. We heard and felt every train going by. I liked the neighbourhood, it was funny to have our first steps into NYC in Chinatown. The location in Manhattan was OK too, near nice neighbourhoods and restaurants/bars in Lower east side. In short: good location and nice rooms, but noisy. They charge for storing your bags, $ 2 a piece.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, friendly staff, train tracks at your window!”
Reviews.Author: traveller2721
Reviews.Content: It's a cool space, in Chinatown. The location was great but we had a room that overlooked the train! Sleep was hard, but otherwise a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “is ok but prefer a better neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: oceanrfrizz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice had a clean comfortable bed, the bathroom is clean, the staff is ok, dont use their transportation service is a rip off, just get a cab out side, outside of the hotel smell like a fish, well is in the midle of china town, so go figure, is kinda dead at night a little scary to walk to the subway, so at night we get a cab instead, there is a lot of chinese restaurant arround, we tried a few places since we love chinese food they all great. if you on the budget this might a good place stay, but I wouldnt pay more than 100/night to stay here, I rather move to long island city much cheaper and more better neighborhood!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ramgrrl
Reviews.Content: Although I am a frequent traveler to NYC, this was my first stay at this hotel. Several of the previous reviewers make mention of the subway right next to the hotel. The room we booked was directly across from the train. Although we called down to the reception desk to see if we could be moved, there were no rooms available for us to change. I was not very worried, but my friend is a fairly light sleeper. Overall, the sound was not too bad and much like living near an airport, you just become used to it. After a long day of walking and sightseeing (and a belly full of good food and drink), I probably could fall asleep in the middle of Times Square! The room itself was pretty stark. Not even any artwork on the walls, however the room itself was large enough for our two full beds and still plenty of room to walk around. The elevators are a little slow, but with only a few floors, it's not like the wait was hours. The hotel does have free internet, although it is wired, not wireless. The bathroom had a bathtub, which is not all that common in NYC. The location is interesting because you are so far South on Manhattan. If you don't mind walking, within 10-15 blocks are lots of restaurants and shops in the Lower Eastside (LES) and Little Italy. There are a couple of subway stations within a few blocks, but strangely enough, we never took them. We would walk towards SoHo and LES at the start of each day. By the evenings, we were generally in Midtown, so we would take a cab back after a long day of sightseeing (with plenty of eating!). I would say this hotel is probably better if you are just a little bit adventurous, especially given the location is a bit off the beaten tourist path. I for one will include this hotel on my list of favorites to consider the next time I am in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: lime999
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three day trip to NYC, this hotel was very clean and comfortable. the room was very large for a city room and the bathroom was clean and updated. The train noise was no problem at all, the windows are super insulated and you only hear a low rumble. Our room looked out over the street and was great for people watching. There is a subway stop 2 blocks down with easy access. This place is in Chinatown and it is a gritty and dirty neighborhood that is also interesting and very different. Our 5 year old loved it. Can't beat the price, people at the desk were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Inexpensive Manhattan Gem Located In Chinatown !”
Reviews.Author: CandS2009
Reviews.Content: We have stayed her two times now and it has been great each time. The staff is wonderful and helpful, the location is great for easy access to the subway or other burroughs, and Chinatown is always busy. The rooms are small but so are most rooms in NYC regardless of price. But they are always clean and well appointed. Make sure to request to stay away from the bridge side of the hotel which is close to a overhead road. We have never had any problems with noise from it though. You can never beat the price especially given how clean the hotel is. It is located smack dab in the middle of Chinatown so there is always a lot to take in and see.

Reviews.Title: “With tracks so close, we didn't expect to sleep but we slept great!”
Reviews.Author: eagle3Texas
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed that I left a pair of $132.00 SAS shoes that had onlt been worn 4 hours and the staff did not find them. We left keysat a S. Dakota hotel one time and they were mailed to us before we got home. They were keys for the kids to play with and weren't needed, but they took responsibility to mail an igem that was left. I would pay COD for my shoes. Like so many others, I work hard for my income. It soured my stay to know that someone was dishonest. I just hope they could wear my 101/2 Wides.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, good value, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MDfamily1
Reviews.Content: My 11 year old son and I stayed in a double twin room for one night; it was close to the Subway and others stated, it seemed to be in a safe neighborhood. The hotel is very clean and the rooms were actually pretty roomy by NY standards. The only problems were that the train bridge is really noisy - this didn't bother us b/c we were exhausted and had the AC on (between the hum and the train rumble, it just created some white noise) -and the shower pressure was low (but the water was hot). The staff was very helpful in providing directions to Battery Park via the bus. All in all an excellent value for a very clean hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1980nn
Reviews.Content: We just got back from this hotel and here are my thoughts: It is in the middle of Chinatown. The area is pretty flithy and somewhat smelly. There is no place to grab a drink before going in at the end of the night. I have read on here that the windows didn't open, ours did and it was both a good and bad thing. The room was too hot. There was a control for the air conditioner unit in the room but it didn't work. We weren't really told anything when we reported it, just sort of stared at. So we opened the window for some air but the noise was the worst I have ever experienced. EVER. The room was clean and small. The bathroom is roomy with lots of hot water. The price was great. We bought ear plugs for the second night and that helped a great deal. The F train is fairly close -- but it takes a while to get to midtown. Little Italy being so close was fun and we got some great pictures of the Manhattan bridge. The people that stayed in the hotel were quiet, which sort of surprised me since they were so young. I was concerned about security. I wanted to make a pit stop just to check on our things. But it just isn't the kind of place to you want to stop back by to recharge, we stayed out the whole time and risked it.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap - Comfortable - Very Nice Staff - Good Area”
Reviews.Author: JohnLoughman
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived back from New York after 3 nights. Stayed in Hotel 91 for all nights. The hotel is in China town, which is very busy by day but quiet and safe by night. Walking the streets can be a little unpleasant during the day as there's lots of fish markets around so it can smell a bit. Lots of people on here have complained about the noise from the bridge, we stayed on the second floor in room 203, it's level with the bridge and right next to reception. I didn't find the bridge too noisey, but at times you could really hear people on reception talking loudly. Rooms are pretty small, but room for 2 double beds, wardrobe, bedside table, desk and TV table. The bathroom is really nice and the room was very clean. This hotel was great value for money, cost $400 for 2 people for 3 nights, not bad rates considering the location, 10 minute walk from China Town and close to a subway up to 34th street. Also close enough to walk from the liberty Island ferry and a few other attractions in the lower east side. Nice bars and restraunts around Allen and Delancey, went out on Sat night in a place called White Place Slab opposite Starbucks on the corner, very nice night out. All in all, if you're not an extremely light sleeper and only need somewhere to put your head down that's close midtown then you can go wrong with Hotel 91

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mixedlollies
Reviews.Content: I managed to wrangle $99 a night (not including taxes of course), but I searched online for ages for a great deal and this was by far the best. I ended up getting upgraded to a King Size bed, and requested to be away from the overpass. That's probably my only advice for this place. It was clean, 24 hour reception (I had to leave at 5am to catch a plane), bathroom was lovely, very close to great Asian food. Also free internet if you've got your laptop. I think they probably get a lot of Asian tourists, business travelers. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Odalis05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 91 when I went to visit a couple of cousins of mine. The hotel is right in Chinatown and just 2 blocks away from the train. The neighborhood does smell like fish though but you never smelled that inside of the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised when I got to my room and saw that I actually had room to walk in. Actually, three of us were able to stay in the room and were completely fine. The bathroom was good except the shower head was kind of weak. The only other bad thing is that the train runs right by the room we were staying in but at night it wasn't too bad. I was very happy with the hotel and location. I would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat for the price”
Reviews.Author: B2_Spirit
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel on the lower west side of manhattan. I do a lot of research before booking a hotel and this seemed to be the best compromise between location, price and quality. Firstly the bad points. We stayed for a total of four nights in two different rooms. The first room had two queen beds and the second had two single beds. Both rooms looked onto the manhattan bridge (which is used by both cars and the subway). If you are a light sleeper, I would not recommend this hotel especially if you have a room overlooking the bridge. I personally am a light sleeper but I think the combination of adjusting to the different time zone and fatigue from walking around all day meant that I wasn't woken too often. I spoke to a couple staying at the hotel who didn't fair as well as I did and had a hard time sleeping. The only way to get around this is to insist on a room not facing Manhattan bridge. The location is both good and bad depending how you look at it. It is 5-7 minutes walk to the E broadway subway station but it is also in the middle of Chinatown. I'm not a big fan of chinese food so I had to usually walk to Little Italy (15 minutes) to get something to eat. There are only oriental restaurants within 10-15 minutes walk. Also, being in chinatown means you have to put up with the smells of fish and piles of rubbish bags in the street. The location is therefore not for everyone. The rooms are modern and clean. The size of the rooms were fine as well. We didn't have any issues with the reception staff. They were helpful. I've given this hotel a 4 rating purely because it is probably the best value for money hotel in manhattan. You will find cheaper and in a better mid-town location but only if you are prepared to share a bathroom and compromise on the quality of the hotel. Overall, a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out Perfectly”
Reviews.Author: SCworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Since our primary mission was to celebrate New Year's Eve on Time Square ( ...and we did rather closely @ 45th & 7th and waited only from 10:30-midnight, because we bought tickets to HA Comedy Club and after the show the NYPD let us into the pen), I was initially concerned because the location was not close to Midtown. However, as it turned out there was NO need to have worried. The East Broadway Metro station was a little less than 2 blocks from the hotel and took us everywhere we wanted to go. Since there was only the "F" train, it was simple to navigate to all of our destinations. Within 15 minutes we were at 42nd & 6th Ave, which is Bryant Park. To get to Times Square all you had to do was walk one block over to 7th ave and you were there. During New Year's Eve this worked out perfectly, because we did not encounter a lot of foot traffic either coming or going. If you got off the train one stop earlier at 34th and 6th Ave. you were right in Herald Square (Penn Staion/Madison Square Garden/ Empire State Building). One stop after Bryant Park/Times Square you were at Rockefeller Plaza location and one block over by foot you were in the midst of Broadway. With this hotel and its easy access "F" train we went everywhere we wanted to go in short time without any confusion. We even felt secure enough for our teen sons (14 & 16) to catch the train from the hotel and meet up with us later. As well, the hotel felt safe. The staff was young, yet very friendly and professional. The room (double queen), although very small, it did accomodate the 4 of us after we strategically placed our luggage. The room was clean and we were fortunate enough to be on the second floor which had the lounge area, big plasma screen TV and 24 hr. coffee and tea. Sometimes we hung out there when we needed a little more elbow room. Even with this lounge on the 2nd floor, it was always quiet in our room which was right next to it. I believe the rooms are very well sound proofed, as we also faced the Manhattan Bridge side, but was not truly disturbed by the train noise. You heard a low rumble periodically, but it was not noticeable and definitely did not awake us or prevent us from going to sleep. Although most of the sinage on the establishments in that area were written in Chinese, there were still places to go. There's a nice LITTLE diner one block up on Canal Street called Cup and Saucer. They serve large, tasty portions at fairly reasonable prices. They also deliver with a minimal purchase of $10. There's also a Popeye's Chicken a street over from Cup and Saucer. And there are a number of Chinese restaurants, with a few a bit more Americanized than the rest. There were massage, facial and hair salons that appeared busy and talented, although I did not personally visit any. And let's not forget the shopping on Canal street. I will attach pictures later, but the hotel is pretty much as depicted on their website; however, our room only had a view of the bridge. But with the total rate of $680 for 4 nights (during New Year's Eve) through Hotels.com, I definitely won't and can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our purposes.”
Reviews.Author: llmwg03
Reviews.Content: I traveled to NYC with my three college age children for an early Christmas present. Our goal was a comfortable clean room at a good price as we knew we only needed to sleep and shower. Hotel 91 was perfect! The two queen beds were incredibly comfortable with clean white bedding. The bathroom was very clean with good water pressure. Not alot of extra room but enough room so that everyone had their space for their suitcases. The internet cable in the room was used extensively with my son's laptop for those daily Facebook updates! We loved being in the heart of Chinatown and easy walking distance to Little Italy. My daughter and I took advantage of a great inexpensive foot massage ($25 for 40 minutes) at one of the local businesses. The folks at the front desk were very helpful. They held our bags the last day and ordered a car for us to take us back to JFK. Very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect hotel for us!”
Reviews.Author: scgigi
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Hotel 91 was absolutely perfect for us! 3 rooms fronting E. Broadway were very large, huge bathrooms, very clean and new. Fabulous beds, great windows with great views, downtown Chinatown! Less than 2 blocks to subway, walking distance to Little Italy, helpful, friendly staff, could not have been better. Plus 3 bakeries to choose from each morning for Char-su-bow or however you spell it, incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you know a few things”
Reviews.Author: sheilad1
Reviews.Content: First be sure you are GUARANTEED to be on the side of the hotel away from the bridge. If you face the bridge it is very noisy and you maybe very upset. Second know that you are in Chinatown. I love Chinatown and needed to stay in lower manhattan but it is a bit out of the way for some people. It is very clean, new and the customer service is great. It is however minimalist. You get everything you need but not a thing more. There is no wireless - there is hard wired DSL and in our room the cable was next to the phone on a TINY night stand with a short cable. We had two queen beds and the room was quite large. The desk was also tiny. The free coffee in the lobby is instant coffee and hot water. Cabs are fairly easy to get in China

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice!”
Reviews.Author: photogirl_7
Reviews.Content: In the middle of bustling Chinatown is Hotel 91. Immediately surprised by its cleanliness and comfortable beds! The property has a very "fresh" feel. Our room had 2 double beds (they reminded us of the Westin's "Heavenly Beds". A/C was very quiet and efficient, plenty of hot water, free high speed ethernet, flat screen tv. Overall room size was a bit small, the window view on the 6th floor was the traffic/train of the Manhattan Bridge (almost touching distance!). A bit noisy, but the double-paned windows helped and it didn't interrupt sleep. No fridge, We only saw Chinese food nearby (Starbucks about 1/2 mile away). "Complimentary coffee and tea" on 2nd floor was a hot pot with instant Folgers or tea bags. Walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge, Ground Zero. Good value for money. Nice and helpful staff. Parking at $32/day on Henry St (near the backdoor entrance to hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Solid value for money”
Reviews.Author: PZnaty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not fancy or anything but the location is great and the room is good. You only get a room and some vending machines - no restaurant/bar or room service - but that's all you really need. No bedbugs and the room is cleaned every day. I got an offer on the room (104 $/night) and the price was definitely right. The hotel is smack down in Chinatown which worked for me since I spent most my time in LES and the Chinese surroundings is a good experience - like being in China actually. :-) I got a room right next to the the train track on Manhattan Bridge but was not disturbed by the noise even though the trains keeps at it all night. There's a double window frame so most of the noise is blocked out. You can find better hotels (but then again probably also more expensive) but definitely also worse, so Hotel 91 is worth a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Please Stay, you will not regret it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Burley42
Reviews.Content: The reason we stayed here is because of the rate. We had a great time. The room very clean. The customer service was just pure de awesome. The thing that we did not like was that it was 4 of us and the room was very small. The noise did not bother us not one bit. Plenty of transportation service all around the area. No complaints what so ever and will stay there when we all go back to NEW YORK again. Thank You Hotel 91 for all your help. I wanted to take the bed home with me, it was so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: frenchcdric
Reviews.Content: Hotel 91 is great. Not expensive -throught hotels.com- and so conviniently located at the heart of Manhattan. Chinatown is a great place to stay, very charming despite the fish smell in the streets. The room was clean and I almost didn't hear the noise from the bridge thanks to the double-double windows !

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: shazz16
Reviews.Content: stayed for 8 nights - the beds are great - the bathrooms clean... we faced the train and could hardly hear a thing... they provide a great lounge with free tea and coffee 24/7... It is right in the heart of Chinatown with a fish market on the street which adds to the local flavour. Canal Street is a short walk away. A brillant restaurant called Bacaro is in Division street a 2 minute walk away... well worth a visit !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfy beds, no breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: saturnspeak
Reviews.Content: I've done a fair bit of travelling and for what I'd term as a budget hotel (compared with other hotels in New York) you're very well looked after and the rooms are very clean and comfortable. The only downside if I could pick anything is the location. There are subways to the rest of Manhattan from Chinatown but if you're wanting to go out in the evening for a drink near the hotel there really isn't anywhere. If you're walking towards City Hall (out of the main hotel door, turn left) however you will catch a glimpse of a "Subway" if you like your sandwiches - I think I've had about 5 from there and the staff were good. Great hotel for.... - Sleeping (I want to take the bed home with me, the mattress is great) - Relaxing for short periods (they have a vending machine on the 4th floor for drinks/snacks) - Internet (ONLY if you bring your own laptop)...there's blue ethernet cables in the rooms and its free to use, however there is a communal PC on the 4th floor but you have to pay to use it (weird, really). Bad for... - If you have a late night there aren't any "Do Not Disturb" hangers. So be prepared to make your own somehow or you'll have some aggressive banging on your door "Housekeeping....housekeeping" for 5 minutes straight. Worst of it all is you can't predict when they're coming it seems to vary. The only thing that stopped them getting in was locking the door. Looking at other reviews, my room faces the train bridge and it does sound a bit like distant thunder as they go by but unless you're a very light sleeper it's not going to affect you.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel service i have ever had”
Reviews.Author: SusanVanc0uver
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience at this hotel. It does not look at all like the pics on the website! And yes, it is extremely loud because of proximity to bridge traffic. While the hotel does appear clean, I got a RASH from lying in the bed for 10 minutes. When we went to the desk, and asked if they might recommend another hotel in the area, the night shift clerk said that he couldn't say or he would be "helping the competition." He was on his ipod, claiming there was "nothing he could do." We were told that if we wanted to find another hotel we would have to PAY THREE DOLLARS TO USE THE COMPUTER IN THE HALL!! I have stayed in many hotels in my life and have never encountered anyone as rude and inhumane. When a representative from hotels.com called hotel 91 on our behalf (it was 1am and I had hives and no internet), he then reported to me that the hotel clerk had been rude to HIM and told him nasty things about ME! Please don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “nice location near LES shops and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: orangeygirl
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on the room. So based on that alone I would probably stay here again if it was during the spring or fall. The hotel is no where near a subway stop. The closest one is the F train and that is about a 5 or 10 minute walk from the hotel. When I stayed there it was warm, so walking to the subway stop was no big deal, but I can imagine if it was 15 degrees out, I'd be singing a different tune. The hotel is underneath a bridge. So it can get pretty loud noise. I shut the bathroom door, which helped muffle the noise, and luckily my boyfriend and I are fairly deep sleepers. Overall clean hotel, but the bathroom seemed a little dated. There aren't a lot of bells and whistles to the place. It's in the middle of Chinatown, so if you don't like the smell of fish don't stay here. As there are Chinese markets with fish and dried fish galore. I didn't mind the smell because it reminds me of any big Asian metropolitan city. Is the best hotel to stay out in NYC? Probably not. Is it the worst? No.

Reviews.Title: “NOISE”
Reviews.Author: NesteaSinAzucar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights. The room was very small. There was no free internet, no safe. The room is very basically equipped. The bathroom is good, but we had to ask for additional towels. Worst of all: it was EXTREMELY loud. No chance to get sleep without earplugs. Some members of the staff are friendly others definitely aren't.

Reviews.Title: “The Coney Island Express Runs 1 Meter Behind the Hotel--- You Can Imagine What That's Like”
Reviews.Author: Torontoist
Reviews.Content: ***From the perspective of a 26 year old woman from Toronto who often visits NYC and primarily spends her time in the Lower East Side, DUMBO, checking out art galleries, shopping and dining out. ---The Hotel--- The Good: - It's modern and clean. Similar to any budget hotels, although it lacks a few amenities that I consider basic: wi-fi in the rooms, fridge, vending machines etc., - The visitors are mainly Asian tourists and young travelers, both of which you hardly see or hear. The Bad: - Zero security: there are three entrances to the hotel and they are unmanned, the concierge is on a separate floor from the entrances, and anyone can walk-in any of those entrances and take the elevator to any floor in the hotel. There are also no security camera's. - It is 1 meter away from a busy bridge on which the Coney Island express runs and a major road runs underneath. It is extremely loud and the hotel shakes. - There is zero customer service, I personally am not very demanding and don't often need much, but this was ridiculous. The staff were not willing to help you out with anything, and/or did not now the answer to most of the questions asked and were surprised to be asked very basic questions, such as "where can I buy some water?". ---The Area---- The Good: - As far as lower east side hotels this one is fairly cheap and decent. It is close to Brooklyn and LES, and a short walk to the subway. The Bad: - This place is dead...DEAD(for emphasis) after 9 p.m. or so. Everything is boarded up and there is no where to grab a bite or buy snacks. Only the homeless roam the area after a certain hour, and although they are harmless, if your alone it can be unpleasant. - It is in China Town, so it is a bit dirty from the food stores. ---The Rooms--- The Good: - They are typical of the price range, no frills, modest decor. This one is relatively new and things are kept very clean. -Bathroom en-suite, no sharing. The Bad: - They are small, the train running past is loud, the windows don't open. - We didn't really want to go back there much, and sometimes after a long day you need to re-charge for a bit before heading out again. ---The Price--- - Overall it is not that cheap that it would be worthwhile staying here. I would recommend moving uptown or midtown to the cheaper hotels there, despite the less desirable location and being further from LES. - They charge you for storing your bag after checkout; I have never encountered this. They have this dingy internet access station where they charge you quite a lot for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Better Late Than Never (I was waiting on a Pic) :-(”
Reviews.Author: southernease
Reviews.Content: My two grown daughters and I booked Hotel 91 after reading reviews and knowing that it was almost a new property - The price was also a determining factor. We were hesitatant about it being in Chinatown, but having never been to NY, we wanted the full experience. We were very pleased with what we found!!! The staff made our trip the best, by suggesting were to eat and making sure we knew were we were going. Our subway experiences were a learning curve, but we were pros after a couple of days. The subway @ the Manhattan Bridge wasn't so loud, and the people in Chinatown were very nice!!! The "F" subway line that you took to get anywhere was a block and a half away, but if you can't walk that, you don't need to go to NY, it is definitely a walking city!!! The Hotel rooms were small but not to small and the beds were very comfortable, it was also clean!!! We stayed a week and didn't want to leave!!! The shopping on Canal St is just blocks away with great bargains, just hit 5th Ave and compare!!! :-) Many thanks to John, Didio, Howard, Hughes, and William at Hotel 91 for a marvelous trip!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “NOISY IS AN UNDERSTATEMENT”
Reviews.Author: cattytrip
